comments.value:
Email from Huw:

Danny,
I have been asked to send you this questionnaire on Information Security and Business Continuity (attached). The attached cover letter describes the process in more detail. Apologies for giving you more forms to fill in but as I’m sure you can appreciate there is a lot of scrutiny of London 2012 and we do appreciate your help in this. If you need more time to complete the form than the 21 days mentioned in the covering letter or have other questions then please let me know.
Kind Regards,
Huw Williams
OK. I've been ignoring this for the last two weeks, but it needs a response in the next week or so.
Jamie, I am assigning this to you, but please feel free to assign it back to me with instructions on how you want me to go about answering it.
Huw, we haven't forgotten about this one. We hope to have something for you by next week. I hope that's OK.

Jamie, reassigning this back to you. Our security policy is here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hW22bDGfZHYc4lgK-zTCIUiX_CJ4A2YTstrr74pMn1U/edit?hl=en_GB&authkey=CMqu4s8M and Kieran has nominated himself as Officer. I will use this to answer the questions on information security.

Now it's on to Business Continuity, i.e. testing, backup, disaster recovery. If you want, you can bump this straight back to me and I will get on with it.
OK. I know what I am doing tomorrow then :-)
Due date reset to Monday 28th.
Marking as solved.

comments.value:
This is a rather late request for an amendment to the Young Leaders pages which is actually required rather soon. I'm really hoping this doesn't turn out to be too complex, as we need the pages to be editable within a couple of weeks.... My bad, as I have sat on these templates rather too long with being away and everything else I have been juggling.

It is basically a change to the section 'Meet the Young Leaders' http://www.london2012.com/young-leaders/meet to make it function more like a blog. 

So there will be 2 new templates:

1. Revised 'Meet the Young Leaders':  http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/

This page is the generic Young Leaders updates page that shows the latest Young Leaders news and is not specific to any one particular Young Leaders team. Users would get to this page by clicking the Meet the Young Leaders link in the main navigation.

2. Revised team page: http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/index2.html

This is a team specific page (one template that can be used to create individual pages for each team)

 
If you ignore the content and focus on the page templates you can see that they are different. The differences are:
- The generic news template has links to all individual teams in the top section of the page
- The team specific template has links to individual Young Leader pages in the top section of the page, and a link to go back to view all the teams

I have asked PJ at Collective to send through the html to you today - can we have a chat about it when you get it so we can get a sense of how long it will take to implement?

Thanks - and apologies for adding to your already-overflowing plate...

Morag
Marking as high.
Anyone has a zip file in there inbox they don't know what to do with?
Hello - is it possible to let me know your thoughts on this - and if you have any questions? Does end of next week for template handover look feasible? Thanks!
We are aiming to get this done by the end of this week. We are unlikely to be ready to handover before Friday. Estimated time: up to 2 days.

Hi Danny

Can we do our best for end of Friday on this? Internal client needs to be able to input content next week.

Thank you

We do still need to take a bit of time out to get the new pages looking right on staging. I have just (re-)published the new stylesheets now that the /css folder is not being synched to live. This will need a bit of attention (hopefully not much) on Monday.

I have agreed with Morag that the image carousel in the original blog designs are a bit of a stretch.

We are keeping this to 2 days, which is about right in terms of Lars' time.

Morag

Will take a look at Young Leaders..

To get the Flash player to update a (normal html) <div> element (ie. a block of html) on the page, the Flash player itself would need to be updated, although I can't see any reason why it shouldn't be /technically/ possible (I'm no Flash expect but the docs seem to say you can do this).

I'm not saying it's trivial and it may be that all TwoFour do is re-skin/re-brand (an existing) Flash player rather than having the ability to create a different version of it with this extra functionality.

Just spoke to Danny on this.

We have a number of Windows Media files we need to make available for download from our Get Set site.

The longer-term solution for this will be TwoFour, but they are proving very slow, so I need to find a temporary home for these files. Most are in the region of 15-25MB. An inventory is attached, indicating the current place to download these files from.

Is it possible please to upload these files and send me the link to their new home?

This will hopefully only be for the duration of about a week. Time is pretty critical on this (blame me for bad management) and I would need the links by the end of today please, as the current host is switched off at midnight.

Thank you so much!

Morag

Feb 1 is looking unlikely. We are planning to send a test feed over to e-Dialog this week, but it will be very surprising if the switchover can be concluded in January.

That’s fine – we are now expecting this to take longer than originally planned.

Aiming for 1 March now

Update: We have sent a large subset of the user database (via the secure feed mechanism) and are awaiting feedback from e-Dialog.

Assuming there are no major issues, we should be able to switch to a daily feed as soon as we hear back from e-Dialog.
J: So far I have spent ~8 days on this

So far we have spent :

- Jamie: ~1 day communication / investigation / calls etc. 
- Kieran: 3 days development of PGP/GPG extension layer so we can encrypt the feeds
- Jamie: ~5 days development of new feed / technical liaison / changes
- plus any time we spend from here onwards on it on testing / switch over etc etc etc.

<said previously when it was 6 days>In addition I expect we'll spend another 2 to 3 days making changes to the feed and liaising with eDialog post us sending them our initial test feed and also checking everything is OK once we switch to the live feed, factored into that is time for communication /  testing that everything is matching up. But if things get complex (*) or ITS need our time for further tests or a more complex deployment testing or migration process then that would need additional time</said previously>
Another .2 for Kieran, dealing with eDialog while Jamie away.

And another .2 for Kieran, dealing with Karlan last week and running incremental feed this morning.

Total:
Kieran> 0.4

This is all enabled, and working now.
Keeping an eye out for any teething problems.
Great – thanks!
Running total: 8.5 days.

comments.value:
Hi Justin,

Are you saying you want a different venue / image to show on the actual basketball page than on the venue page for the basketball arena?

The venue images on the sport page is just sucked across from the venue attached to that sport (which is set in the metadata tab for that sport).

We can't easily change the order they appear in, at the moment I think they display in whatever order the venue pages were created or last published in, we could try and make them alphabetical but although it would fix the Basketball case, it wouldn't work for other pages. Is a venue ever both a primary and secondary venue for two sports (ie. could we add a priority to the venue page itself; although be aware it wouldn't be a priority related to it being used for a given discipline, just a priority over other venues)

- Basketball venue page
Page  --> http://www.london2012.com/games/venues/basketball-arena.php
Image --> http://www.london2012.com/images/venues/venues-basketball-arena-500x173.jpg

- Basketball page
Page  --> http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sports/basketball.php
Image --> http://www.london2012.com/transform/2047862/sc220x120/venues-basketball-arena-500x173.jpg

Hi Jamie,

For example - I have changed the image on the venue page for basketball to the correct new CGI.  But when you go to the basketball Olympic sport page the image is of the old CGI (it's a subtle difference but the cladding is different).  I do not know how to change this image as I have already updated the image in the Venues page in CMS and i was led to believe this should update the image on the basketball sport page.

Same for Hockey - I have updated the Venue page with the new CGI but i don't see how to change the sport page?

Hope that makes sense and i'm not just being a massive idiot!



Cheers,
Justin.


-----Original Message-----

Hi Justin

I have altered the order the venues are pulled back in to be Alphabetical, this fixes the issue on the Basketball page, but there is no reason to think this ordering will work on other sports, in fact we may even find pages that previously had the correct order now have the wrong order.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/basketball.php 

Obvious as it may seem at a high level, technically it's not easy to change that component so that the venues appear in the same order as they are entered into the meta data tab/field.

I am closing this ticket, and have opened a new ticket here with a more specific title, but it is very unlikely we will have this resolved this week.
